description:
Lone parents

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12211 Microcensus

Definition:
Lone parents (until 1995):
Mothers and fathers living without a spouse but with
never-married children in a household. It is irrelevant
whether other persons live in the household (e.g. the
partner in a cohabiting couple), in addition to the lone
parent and the children.

Lone parents (from 1996):
Mothers and fathers living without a spouse or cohabiting
partner but with never-married children in a household. A
parent with a cohabiting partner in the household is
considered a cohabiting couple with children.
